example[0]: She thrust a letter into my hand.
example[1]: He thrust me roughly towards the door.
definition[1]: to make a sudden movement forward with a sword or knife
example[2]: He skipped aside as his opponent thrust at him.
definition[2]: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
example[3]: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
definition[3]: the main meaning or aim of what someone is saying or doing
example[4]: the main thrust of the governmentâ€™s education policy
definition[4]: the force of an engine that makes a car, train, or plane move forward
